definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with

sentences.english: Jo wrathfully proposed that Mr. Davis be arrested without delay.
sentences.chinese: 裘怒冲冲地提议，应当把戴维先生毫不迟延地逮起来。

sentences.english: I gave him a black look .
sentences.chinese: 我怒冲冲地看了他一眼。

sentences.english: She had risen, and now walked angrily out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 她已站了起来，怒冲冲地朝门口走。

sentences.english: She was very angry and marched out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 她怒冲冲地快步走出了门。

sentences.english: He left in a huff and a car.
sentences.chinese: 他怒冲冲地坐汽车走了。

sentences.english: In the streets, angrily walked m France.
sentences.chinese: 在街道上，米法怒冲冲地走着。

sentences.english: He left the room in a huff.
sentences.chinese: 他怒冲冲地离开了房间。

sentences.english: I say furiously as my mother enters.
sentences.chinese: 我怒冲冲地说，这时我母亲进来了。

sentences.english: She heatedly stormed into the room to confront her husband's lover.
sentences.chinese: 她怒冲冲地冲进房间去质问丈夫的情人。

sentences.english: The tiger lashed its tail angrily.
sentences.chinese: 老虎怒冲冲地摆着尾巴。

sentences.english: She went out of the room in a huff .
sentences.chinese: 她怒冲冲地走出了房间。

definition: scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
see 惱羞成怒|恼羞成怒[nao3 xiu1 cheng2 nu4]
